paragraphs.content: A British Columbia Secondary School Diploma or equivalent with prior education in English at grade 10 level or higher OR
Pass the AOLCC Entrance Evaluation with 75% or higher (demonstrating both English comprehension and math skills) OR
Applicants who do not meet one of the requirements above must provide proof of English proficiency through an English language assessment (IELTS 5.5 or CELPIP 6)

In the IT Tech Support Specialist diploma program, students will learn to design, implement, manage, and maintain computers and network installations. The program covers a wide range of topics from hardware installation, configuration, networking to Windows operating systems, server administration, security tools and procedures, and cloud computing with Azure services.
Throughout the program, students will gain experience with a wide range of hands-on practice labs exercises.

The program helps students prepare for industry-standard certification examinations including Computing Technology Industry Association (CompTIA) A+, Network+, Server+, Security+, and Microsoft 365: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate, Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals, and  Administrator Associate.

Relevant job titles include: information technology support technician, technical support specialist – information technology, system support representative, technical support agent, technical support representative.
Upon completion of this program the successful student will have reliably demonstrated the ability to:
Learn to deploy, configure, manage devices and data with Windows 10
Use MS Word core features to create, format, and edit documents, work with styles, and insert tables and images
Use MS Excel core features to create and format worksheets, use functions, and create formulas
Use MS Access to build a database, create database tables and populate them, establish relationships between tables, create forms and reports, and how to run queries to retrieve data from databases

paragraphs.li_title: Prepare for CompTIA’s A+ certification exams:
paragraphs.content: Learn about PC hardware and peripherals, mobile device hardware, networking and troubleshooting hardware and network connectivity issues; learn to install and configure multiple operating systems, address security, the fundamentals of cloud computing, and operational procedures

paragraphs.li_title: Prepare for CompTIA’s Network+ certification exam:
paragraphs.content: Learn about configuring, troubleshooting, and managing common network wireless and wired devices, basic network design and connectivity, understand and maintain network documentation, identify network limitations and weaknesses, and implement network security, standards, and protocols

paragraphs.li_title: Prepare for CompTIA’s Server+ certification exam:
paragraphs.content: Learn about server administration concepts, virtualization and cloud computing, physical and network security, managing physical inventory and assets, server hardware, storage management, install and configure an OS, troubleshoot OS, application, and networks, manage data security and service and data availability, and decommission servers

paragraphs.li_title: Prepare for CompTIA’s Security+ certification exam:
paragraphs.content: Learn about security concepts, tools, and procedures to react to security incidents; it ensures that security personnel are anticipating security risks and guarding against them

Learn about cloud computing, managing Azure services, Azure storage, software development, security and compliance; learn to manage Azure DNS and network security, implement and manage storage, deploy and manage virtual machines, configure and manage virtual networks, and users
